events.title: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
events.description: Romulus Augustulus, the last Roman emperor of the West, was deposed by the Germanic king Odoacer. This event is traditionally marked as the end of Ancient Rome and the beginning of the Middle Ages in Europe.
events.significance: Signaled the collapse of centralized Roman authority in the West, leading to significant cultural and political transformations in Europe.

events.title: First Issue of National Geographic Magazine Published
events.description: The National Geographic Society published the first issue of its magazine, which would become famous for its detailed scientific articles and spectacular photography.
events.significance: Marked the beginning of a major platform for geography, exploration, and education globally.

events.title: Herman Wouk's 'The Caine Mutiny' Wins Pulitzer Prize
events.description: The novel 'The Caine Mutiny' was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction, recognizing the work's impact on American literature and its portrayal of naval life during WWII.
events.significance: Highlighted critical perspectives on leadership and morality during wartime.

events.title: Apple Introduces the iMac
events.description: Apple Inc. announced the release of the first-generation iMac, an all-in-one personal computer designed by Jony Ive that revitalized the company's fortunes.
events.significance: Marked a pivotal moment in personal computing design and Apple's resurgence in the tech industry.
